intro: Schoberia microphylla, commonly known as the small-leaved Schoberia, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate flowers. It is a perennial herb with slender, branching stems that often grow in open, sunny habitats. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves that are typically less than 1 inch in length, giving it a delicate appearance. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers appear in clusters, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Schoberia microphylla is native to regions of Europe and is often found in meadows and woodland edges.
